metadata.title: CVE-2020-8608 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In libslirp 4.1.0, as used in QEMU 4.2.0, tcp_subr.c misuses snprintfreturn values, leading to a buffer overflow in later code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8608` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

slirp - 1:1.0.17-7+deb8u2build0.14.04.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: qemu package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
slirp package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.0.17-7+deb8u2build0.14.04.1+esm1').
